WebProjects.name: Obsidian
WebProjects.description: This is a clone of the Obsidian website, made for improving my developing skills. It is the landing page of the site. I tried to make this page without seeing the original html because I thought that doing it this way would make it harder to clone.
WebProjects.opinion: Obsidian its a software that I like very much, I really recommend you to try it!

technologies.name: HTML5
technologies.description: HTML for the entire Site

technologies.name: CSS3
technologies.description: CSS for the styling

technologies.name: SASS
technologies.description: CSS extension for preprocessing the styles in a more eficient way

WebProjects.name: Ironplant.cl
WebProjects.description: This is a Remake of the Ironplant website, a Vegan brand selling food supplements. It is the final project I made for the React Js bootcamp at Coderhouse. In this project you can actually simulate a purchase, it has itemlists, filtered items, item details, cart and a checkout form.

technologies.name: React JS
technologies.description: One library to rule them all

technologies.name: MateriaUI
technologies.description: Some components made with mui. It's faster

technologies.name: Firebase
technologies.description: The database of products and customers are located in firebase

WebProjects.name: My Portfolio
WebProjects.description: This is my porfolio and I'm showing you this project while you browse through this site. It contains all my art and web development works and also a blog where I write some stuff of my interest and some tales of mine.

WebProjects.name: Language Spin
WebProjects.description: This is a language course platform, I worked at this project as a team made up of the best students of the latest bootcamps of web development and web design at 'Coderhouse' an e-learning platform based in Argentina, so it was a excelent job experience and the result was this site made for a language course institute, they teach English, Spanish, Italian and Portuguese

WebProjects.name: Pokemon Center
WebProjects.description: This is a project that I did for the challenges of the Javascript Course at Coderhouse, It is a pokemon center simulator but privatized and it charges a certain amount of money to heal your pokemons. It is made with the pokeAPI, with that I got all the data of your pokemons, including the sprites.
WebProjects.opinion: using pokeAPI its a great way to learn to use APIs and fetch data from databases!
